note: This data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices.
title: National poverty line vs. GDP per capita
subtitle: A national poverty line is the minimum level of income considered adequate to live in a particular country. People living below this income are considered poor. This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
internalNotes: The year is fixed in 2017 because the work of Jollife et al. was to define the 2017 prices with 2017 poverty lines (and some previous to 2017)
